condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and their families benefit from parenting services and programmes as part of integrated early childhood development services at the local level

description.narrative: UNICEF Chile contributed to improve the quality of parenting programmes by developing an instrument to review their compliance with UNICEF´s global standards for early childhood parenting programmes. UNICEF generated evidence on parents' knowledge and parenting practices, which will strengthen public policies to support family. UNICEF Chile promoted the inclusion of immigrant children in preschool education by disseminating a study that highlight opportunities and bottlenecks. During the social unrest, UNICEF designed guidelines and provided supports to the workshops organized by the Undersecretary of Children to support parents and caregivers of children affected by the social crisis. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/02/2020

title.narrative: Model of parenting programme coordinated with the social protection system designed, implemented, validated and evaluated at the local level.

baseline.value: There are parenting programs or communitarian spaces for parents, but there are not coordinated with social protection local services.

target.value: 2022:There is a designed, validated and evaluated model of coordinated parenting programs and services implemented in 3 municipalities.

title.narrative: Early learning policy and early learning programme ensuring parents and communities involvement.

baseline.value: There is no parenting programmes and services as an integrate policy that ensure ECD at the local level.

target.value: 2022:There is a coordinated parenting programmes and services with a common framework that ensure ECD at the local level.
